attributes.action: Abolish employers national insurance contributions for schools
attributes.additional_details: Schools are publicly funded - they rely on money from taxpayers. Requiring them to pay employer NICs means that a big portion of that funding is immediately lost, reducing the amount available for education. Taxing tax-funded institutions is an entirely unfair double tax that makes absolutely no fiscal sense.  The upcoming increase is placing even greater and unnecessary financial pressure on schools, flying in the face of manifesto promises to "Deliver high and rising standards in education"
attributes.background: We urge the government to scrap Employers' National Insurance Contributions for all state-funded schools to ensure that taxpayer money is fully utilised for education.

rejection.details: Details of the National Insurance contributions (NICs) grant can be found here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-insurance-contributions-nics-grant-and-early-years-national-insurance-contributions-ey-nics-grant-for-2025-to-2026/national-insurance-contributions-nics-grant-methodology-april-2025-to-march-2026
